Projects

My projects are minimalist, opinionated, and built to be understood. I prioritise technical restraint over complexity to ensure decision grade signal.

Policy Shock Simulator

First order macro impact modelling.
Open Repository

The Problem

Policy shifts, such as inflation, tax, or contribution rate changes, often have non-linear impacts on long term capital outcomes that are poorly understood by decision makers.

Technical Approach

A deterministic scenario engine I built to model the sensitivity of retirement outcomes to specific policy shocks without the noise of stochastic volatility.

Strategic Value

Enables CIOs to answer 'what if' questions during regime shifts with immediate, explainable data.

Member Outcome Engine

Outcome centric fund analytics.
Open Repository

The Problem

Institutional reporting focuses on relative performance, such as benchmarks, rather than the absolute reality of member retirement sufficiency.

Technical Approach

This tool translates high level fund data into human metrics, specifically replacement ratios and funded years.

Strategic Value

I position retirement fund leadership around the only metric that matters, which is the member's quality of life.

Strategic Metric Translator

Bridging the technical governance gap.
Open Repository

The Problem

Engineers and quants provide data while Boards require strategic judgment. The translation layer is often lost in translation.

Technical Approach

A rule based mapping engine I designed to generate markdown board packs from technical output.

Strategic Value

I ensure technical risk is communicated with executive clarity, not jargon.

Decision Scenario Tree

Simplified decision architecture.
Open Repository

The Problem

Traditional decision trees are either too simple, such as manual trees, or too complex, such as black box AI.

Technical Approach

YAML defined logic trees I developed to allow for probability weighting and expected value calculations.

Strategic Value

Forces clarity in assumptions during complex, multi stage decision processes.

All my projects are licensed under the MIT Open Source standard.
